meanings.definition: A person or machine that removes material from the bottom of a body of water.
meanings.sent1: The dredgers worked hard to clear the riverbed.
meanings.sent2: The company invested in new dredgers to deepen the harbor.
meanings.sent3: The little toy boat pretended to be a dredger in the bathtub.
meanings.sent4: The dredgers were like busy ants, moving sediment from the river.
meanings.sent5: The loud hum of the dredgers echoed across the lake.

meanings.sent1: The dredgers sailed out to sea to begin their work.
meanings.sent2: The old dredger had a rusty hull but still got the job done.
meanings.sent3: The dredger and the fishing boat had a race to see who was faster.
meanings.sent4: The dredger cut through the water like a knife through butter.
meanings.sent5: The crew on the dredger waved to the passing ships.
